description: dog +â€Ž watch, perhaps a calque of German Hundewache.

entries.meaning: (nautical) Aboard a ship, either of the two short two-hour watches that take place between 4 p.m. and 8 p.m.
(by extension) A night shift, or other very late or early period of duty.
(nautical) A very brief period of naval service.
examples: At that time, Captain Thomas G. Peyton, U.S. Navy, who had only served a dog watch as Captain of the Port at Noumea, New Caledonia, reported for this important billet.
